title: Irakere - Grupo Irakere (1979) aka Vol. 3 (1995)
description:
On Ã¢â‚¬Å“Grupo Irakere aka Vol. 3Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ there is more of the swinging fusion of the first album, with a sequel to "Bacalao Con Pan" ("Moja El Pan") and the robust, fascinating, electric guitar-enhanced mini-suite "Juana 1600." 
 A couple of tunes are closer to standard Cuban dance music: "CamagÃƒÂ¼ey" and the traditional "Xiomara Mayoral - Xiomara" sound much like what Los Van Van was playing in this period. 
 Paquito D'Rivera gets to show off his chops on the jazz instrumentals "En Nosotros" and "IyÃƒÂ¡," while "38 1/2," with a squealing guitar lead, an enjoyably unburnished vocal, and a sing-along vocal chant, sounds like Nuyorican salsa at its most experimental.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Grupo IrakereÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ aka Ã¢â‚¬Å“Vol. IIIÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (LD-3660, 1976 / LD-3926, 1979) 
 Using multiple covers for the same album is one of EGREM's favorite tricks, but in this case they outdid themselves, releasing two albums, at least 2 years apart, with different numbers (LD-3660 and LD-3926), the same covers, and different tracklists. On LD-3926 from 1979 Ã¢â‚¬Å“ChÃƒÂ©quere-sonÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is replaced by Ã¢â‚¬Å“CamagÃƒÂ¼eyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½.
It's hard to say why this happened, but when EGREM issued the egregiously under-documented 11-CD Ã¢â‚¬Å“La ColecciÃƒÂ³nÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, they very unfortunately used LD-3926, calling it Vol. 3, even though most or all of its tracks were recorded and released before the album they called Vol. 2!!!
